explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques for credit risk prediction.
explanations.supervised learning: The proposed model is a supervised learning approach as it predicts credit risk based on labeled data.
explanations.classification: The paper focuses on predicting credit risk, which is a classification problem (default or non-default).
explanations.neural network: The paper employs a graph-based neural network (forgeNet) for credit risk prediction.
explanations.deep learning: The graph-based neural network (forgeNet) is a deep learning model.
explanations.feature learning: The paper discusses feature transformation and feature graph mining as part of the model.
explanations.feature representation: The paper transforms original features into a high-dimensional sparse feature matrix.
explanations.XGBoost: XGBoost is used in the first stage of the model to linearize and transform features.
explanations.graph-based neural network: The paper uses a graph-based neural network (forgeNet) to process transformed data and discover feature relationships.
